intro: Xanthium xanthocarpum, commonly known as cocklebur, is an annual herbaceous plant native to North America. It is characterized by its spiny, spherical fruit that contains several seeds. The plant has palmately lobed leaves with a rough, hairy texture. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Xanthium xanthocarpum is known for its ability to produce a large number of seeds, contributing to its invasive potential in certain regions.
